main event: Multiple sightings of a disc-shaped object in Chile in March 1950
interesting points: The first sighting was reported in Punta Arenas on March 11, where many inhabitants reported seeing a disc-shaped object in the sky.
Similar sightings were reported in the Santiago area, San Bernardo and Valparaiso on March 24 and 25, with the usual description of the object being given by the populace.
A third sighting occurred on March 28 over Santiago, where a crowd of people observed the phenomenon.
The Air Attache later concluded that the object witnessed on March 29 was actually the planet Venus, not a flying disc.
Professor Rutland repeated his statement that the objects seen were likely the planet Venus.
location: Chile (Punta Arenas, Santiago, San Bernardo, Valparaiso)
